Hi Patrik, my personal opinion is this may be modern. If it is a tourist 
piece, I think it could be Shouwa period at the earliest.

Best wishes

Richard

Patrik Danielsson wrote:
>
> Hello everybody, i bought this small "tanto" on an ad here in Sweden.
> Its feel really genunine, some kind of hard wood whith nice graining 
> in saya and tsuka, on some places it looks like all the brass has been 
> silverplated (can still se it above tha habaki on one of the photos), 
> i have not been able to take the tsuka of it yet,but i gonna do 
> that,(depending of the answers here :-)
> Can this be a "tourist" thing , or is it made for a child , women or 
> something like that?, if someone have some info age or something i 
> will really happy.
>
> The blade from grip (above habaki) to tip is 6.5 inches / 17 cm, and 
> the total is 10 inches/ 25.5 cm.
>
> Here is some pictures of it:
>
> http://s74.photobucket.com/albums/i248/wellcraftantiqua/japan/ 
> <http://s74.photobucket.com/albums/i248/wellcraftantiqua/japan/>
>
> Thanks alot
>
> Patrik
> Sweden
